text: Anderson is a city in Shasta County, California, United States. It is about south of Redding. 11,323 people lived here at the 2020 census. The city was named after ranch owner Elias Anderson, who granted the Oregon and California Railroad trackage rights and land for a station.Gudde, Erwin; William Bright (2004). California Place Names (Fourth ed.). University of California Press. p. 12. ISBN 978-0-520-24217-3. == References == == Other websites == * Official city website Category:1950s establishments in California Category:1956 establishments in the United States Category:Cities in California Category:Settlements in Shasta County, California
title: Anderson, California
